hedline.hl1: Rejection of the Worst Kind: Ebay Dumps Bond Traders

abstract.p: EBay online auction site pulls offer of a team of emerging-markets bond specialists based in North Korea; eBay allows sales of professional services but not the professionals themselves; Grantham Mayo Van Otterloo & Co fund manager Thomas Cooper, who bid $10 million for team, sees posting as indication that people who sell, trade and analyze emerging-market debt are going begging as some firms exit business (M)

block.p: Visitors to online auction sites know that people try to sell the darnedest things. But a team of emerging-markets bond specialists based in North Korea?

Thomas Cooper, who manages an emerging-markets bond fund at Grantham, Mayo, Van Otterloo & Company in Boston, says he got the point right away when he saw the posting on eBay last week: People who sell, trade and analyze debt issued in emerging markets are going begging as some firms exit that business. Still, he could not resist the temptation and placed a bid of $10 million.
Visitors to online auction sites know that people try to sell the darnedest things. But a team of emerging-markets bond specialists based in North Korea?

Thomas Cooper, who manages an emerging-markets bond fund at Grantham, Mayo, Van Otterloo & Company in Boston, says he got the point right away when he saw the posting on eBay last week: People who sell, trade and analyze debt issued in emerging markets are going begging as some firms exit that business. Still, he could not resist the temptation and placed a bid of $10 million.

His bid was the only one before eBay shut down the auction and wiped it off the site. A spokesman for eBay -- which is still smarting from the recently canceled auction, for $135,805, of a painting that resembled a Diebenkorn -- said eBay allowed sales of professional services but not the professionals themselves.
When a person identifying himself as the seller contacted Mr. Cooper about paying up, he calmly declined.
